title.raw: 《宋微子世家》 House of Song Wei Zi

sentences.zh: 微子開者，殷帝乙之首子而帝紂之庶兄也。

translations.literal: Weizi Kai was the eldest son of Emperor Yi of Yin and the half-brother of Emperor Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Weizi Kai was the eldest son of Emperor Yi of Yin and the half-brother of Emperor Zhou.

sentences.zh: 紂既立，不明，淫亂於政，微子數諫，紂不聽。

translations.literal: When Zhou ascended the throne, he was unenlightened and licentious, disrupting governance. Weizi repeatedly remonstrated, but Zhou would not listen.
translations.idiomatic: When Zhou ascended the throne, he was unenlightened and licentious, disrupting governance. Weizi repeatedly remonstrated, but Zhou would not listen.

sentences.zh: 及祖伊以周西伯昌之修德，滅黎國，懼禍至，以告紂。

translations.literal: When Zu Yi, seeing that Zhou's Western Earl Chang was cultivating virtue and had destroyed the state of Li, feared disaster was coming, and warned Zhou about it.
translations.idiomatic: When Zu Yi saw that Zhou's Western Earl Chang was cultivating virtue and had destroyed the state of Li, he feared disaster was coming and warned Zhou about it.

sentences.zh: 紂曰：「我生不有命在天乎？

translations.literal: Zhou said: 'My life—does it not have its destiny in heaven?
translations.idiomatic: Zhou said: 'My life—does it not have its destiny in heaven?

sentences.zh: 是何能為！」

translations.literal: What can anyone do about it!'
translations.idiomatic: What can anyone do about it!'

sentences.zh: 於是微子度紂終不可諫，欲死之，及去，未能自決，乃問於太師、少師曰：「殷不有治政，不治四方。

translations.literal: Thereupon Weizi realized Zhou could never be remonstrated with. He wanted to die for him, but when he was about to leave, he could not decide, so he asked the Grand Tutor and Junior Tutor: 'Yin has no orderly governance, does not govern the four quarters.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Weizi realized Zhou could never be remonstrated with. He wanted to die for him, but when he was about to leave, he could not decide. So he asked the Grand Tutor and Junior Tutor: 'Yin has no orderly governance and does not govern the four quarters.

sentences.zh: 我祖遂陳於上，紂沈湎於酒，婦人是用，亂敗湯德於下。

translations.literal: My ancestors succeeded in orderly rule above, but Zhou wallows in wine, employs women, disrupting and destroying Tang's virtue below.
translations.idiomatic: My ancestors succeeded in orderly rule above, but Zhou wallows in wine and employs women, disrupting and destroying Tang's virtue below.'

sentences.zh: 殷既小大好草竊姦宄，卿士師師非度，皆有罪辜，乃無維獲，小民乃并興，相為敵讎。

translations.literal: Yin has become great and small, fond of reckless thievery, villainy, and wickedness. The ministers and officials all violate the standards, all have crimes and guilt, yet there is no restraint. The little people all rise up together, becoming enemies to each other.
translations.idiomatic: Yin has become, from great to small, fond of reckless thievery, villainy, and wickedness. The ministers and officials all violate the standards, all have crimes and guilt, yet there is no restraint. The little people all rise up together, becoming enemies to each other.

sentences.zh: 今殷其典喪！
若涉水無津涯。

translations.literal: Like crossing water without ford or shore.
translations.idiomatic: Like crossing water without ford or shore.

sentences.zh: 殷遂喪，越至于今。」

translations.literal: Yin will perish, extending even to today.'
translations.idiomatic: Yin will perish, extending even to today.'

sentences.zh: 曰：「太師，少師，我其發出往？

translations.literal: He said: 'Grand Tutor, Junior Tutor, should I go out and leave?
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Grand Tutor, Junior Tutor, should I go out and leave?

sentences.zh: 吾家保于喪？

translations.literal: Should my family preserve itself in the midst of ruin?
translations.idiomatic: Should my family preserve itself in the midst of ruin?

sentences.zh: 今女無故告予，顛躋，如之何其？」

translations.literal: Now you without reason tell me these dizzying things—what should I do?'
translations.idiomatic: Now you without reason tell me these dizzying things—what should I do?'

sentences.zh: 太師若曰：「王子，天篤下菑亡殷國，乃毋畏畏，不用老長。

translations.literal: The Grand Tutor then said: 'Prince, heaven heavily sends calamity to destroy the Yin state, yet you do not fear fear, do not employ the elderly worthy.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Tutor then said: 'Prince, heaven heavily sends calamity to destroy the Yin state, yet you do not fear and do not employ the elderly worthy.

sentences.zh: 今殷民乃陋淫神祇之祀。

translations.literal: Now the Yin people are vulgar and licentious in their sacrifices to the spirits.
translations.idiomatic: Now the Yin people are vulgar and licentious in their sacrifices to the spirits.

sentences.zh: 今誠得治國，國治身死不恨。

translations.literal: If I can truly obtain orderly rule of the state, even if I die the state will be orderly—I would not regret it.
translations.idiomatic: If I can truly obtain orderly rule of the state, even if I die the state will be orderly—I would not regret it.

sentences.zh: 為死，終不得治，不如去。」

translations.literal: For dying, if I ultimately cannot achieve orderly rule, it would be better to leave.'
translations.idiomatic: For dying, if I ultimately cannot achieve orderly rule, it would be better to leave.'

sentences.zh: 遂亡。

translations.literal: Weizi Kai was the eldest son of Emperor Yi of Yin and the half-brother of Emperor Zhou. When Zhou ascended the throne, he was unenlightened and licentious, disrupting governance. Weizi repeatedly remonstrated, but Zhou would not listen. When Zu Yi, seeing that Zhou's Western Earl Chang was cultivating virtue and had destroyed the state of Li, feared disaster was coming, and warned Zhou about it. Zhou said: 'My life—does it not have its destiny in heaven? What can anyone do about it!' Thereupon Weizi realized Zhou could never be remonstrated with. He wanted to die for him, but when he was about to leave, he could not decide, so he asked the Grand Tutor and Junior Tutor: 'Yin has no orderly governance, does not govern the four quarters. My ancestors succeeded in orderly rule above, but Zhou wallows in wine, employs women, disrupting and destroying Tang's virtue below. Yin has become great and small, fond of reckless thievery, villainy, and wickedness. The ministers and officials all violate the standards, all have crimes and guilt, yet there is no restraint. The little people all rise up together, becoming enemies to each other. Now Yin will surely perish! Like crossing water without ford or shore. Yin will perish, extending even to today.' He said: 'Grand Tutor, Junior Tutor, should I go out and leave? Should my family preserve itself in the midst of ruin? Now you without reason tell me these dizzying things—what should I do?' The Grand Tutor then said: 'Prince, heaven heavily sends calamity to destroy the Yin state, yet you do not fear fear, do not employ the elderly worthy. Now the Yin people are vulgar and licentious in their sacrifices to the spirits. If I can truly obtain orderly rule of the state, even if I die the state will be orderly—I would not regret it. For dying, if I ultimately cannot achieve orderly rule, it would be better to leave.' He then left.

sentences.zh: 箕子者，紂親戚也。
紂始為象箸，箕子嘆曰：「彼為象箸，必為玉桮；

translations.literal: When Zhou first made ivory chopsticks, Jizi sighed and said: 'If he makes ivory chopsticks, he will surely make jade cups;
translations.idiomatic: When Zhou first made ivory chopsticks, Jizi sighed and said: 'If he makes ivory chopsticks, he will surely make jade cups;

sentences.zh: 為桮，則必思遠方珍怪之物而御之矣。

translations.literal: for cups, he will surely think of distant precious strange things to use them.
translations.idiomatic: for cups, he will surely think of distant precious strange things to use them.

sentences.zh: 輿馬宮室之漸自此始，不可振也。」

translations.literal: The gradual decline of carriages, horses, and palaces begins from this—it cannot be reversed.'
translations.idiomatic: The gradual decline of carriages, horses, and palaces begins from this—it cannot be reversed.'

sentences.zh: 紂為淫泆，箕子諫，不聽。

translations.literal: Zhou became licentious and dissipated, Jizi remonstrated, but he would not listen.

sentences.zh: 人或曰：「可以去矣。」
箕子曰：「為人臣諫不聽而去，是彰君之惡而自說於民，吾不忍為也。」

translations.literal: Jizi said: 'As a subject, if I remonstrate and it is not heard and I leave, this makes manifest the lord's evil and makes myself pleasing to the people. I cannot bear to do this.'

sentences.zh: 乃被髪詳狂而為奴。

translations.literal: He then disheveled his hair, feigned madness, and became a slave.

sentences.zh: 遂隱而鼓琴以自悲，故傳之曰箕子操。

translations.literal: He hid away and strummed his zither to express his sorrow, therefore it is transmitted as 'Jizi's Melody.'

Jizi was Zhou's relative. When Zhou first made ivory chopsticks, Jizi sighed and said: 'If he makes ivory chopsticks, he will surely make jade cups; for cups, he will surely think of distant precious strange things to use them. The gradual decline of carriages, horses, and palaces begins from this—it cannot be reversed.' Zhou became licentious and dissipated, Jizi remonstrated, but he would not listen. Someone said: 'You can leave now.' Jizi said: 'As a subject, if I remonstrate and it is not heard and I leave, this makes manifest the lord's evil and makes myself pleasing to the people. I cannot bear to do this.' He then disheveled his hair, feigned madness, and became a slave. He hid away and strummed his zither to express his sorrow, therefore it is transmitted as 'Jizi's Melody.'

sentences.zh: 王子比干者，亦紂之親戚也。

translations.literal: Prince Bigan was also Zhou's relative.

sentences.zh: 見箕子諫不聽而為奴，則曰：「君有過而不以死爭，則百姓何辜！」

translations.literal: Seeing that Jizi remonstrated but was not heard and became a slave, he said: 'If the lord has transgressions and I do not contend with death, then what crime have the hundred surnames committed!'

sentences.zh: 乃直言諫紂。

translations.literal: He then spoke directly remonstrating with Zhou.

sentences.zh: 紂怒曰：「吾聞聖人之心有七竅，信有諸乎？」

translations.literal: Zhou was angry and said: 'I have heard that the sage's heart has seven apertures—is this true?'

sentences.zh: 乃遂殺王子比干，刳視其心。

translations.literal: He then killed Prince Bigan and cut open his chest to examine his heart.

Prince Bigan was also Zhou's relative. Seeing that Jizi remonstrated but was not heard and became a slave, he said: 'If the lord has transgressions and I do not contend with death, then what crime have the hundred surnames committed!' He then spoke directly remonstrating with Zhou. Zhou was angry and said: 'I have heard that the sage's heart has seven apertures—is this true?' He then killed Prince Bigan and cut open his chest to examine his heart.

sentences.zh: 微子曰：「父子有骨肉，而臣主以義屬。

translations.literal: Weizi said: 'Father and son have flesh and blood relations, while lord and subject are connected by righteousness.

sentences.zh: 故父有過，子三諫不聽，則隨而號之；

translations.literal: Therefore if the father has transgressions, the son remonstrates three times and it is not heard, then he follows with wailing;

sentences.zh: 人臣三諫不聽，則其義可以去矣。」

translations.literal: if a subject remonstrates three times and it is not heard, then by righteousness he can leave.'

sentences.zh: 於是太師、少師乃勸微子去，遂行。

translations.literal: Thereupon the Grand Tutor and Junior Tutor advised Weizi to leave, and he then departed.

Weizi said: 'Father and son have flesh and blood relations, while lord and subject are connected by righteousness. Therefore if the father has transgressions, the son remonstrates three times and it is not heard, then he follows with wailing; if a subject remonstrates three times and it is not heard, then by righteousness he can leave.' Thereupon the Grand Tutor and Junior Tutor advised Weizi to leave, and he then departed.

sentences.zh: 周武王伐紂克殷，微子乃持其祭器造於軍門，肉袒面縛，左牽羊，右把茅，膝行而前以告。

translations.literal: When King Wu of Zhou attacked Zhou and conquered Yin, Weizi carried his sacrificial vessels and came to the army gate, bared his flesh and bound his face, leading a sheep on the left, grasping thatch on the right, kneeling and advancing to submit.

sentences.zh: 於是武王乃釋微子，復其位如故。

translations.literal: Thereupon King Wu released Weizi and restored his position as before.

When King Wu of Zhou attacked Zhou and conquered Yin, Weizi carried his sacrificial vessels and came to the army gate, bared his flesh and bound his face, leading a sheep on the left, grasping thatch on the right, kneeling and advancing to submit. Thereupon King Wu released Weizi and restored his position as before.

sentences.zh: 武王封紂子武庚祿父以續殷祀，使管叔、蔡叔傅相之。

translations.literal: King Wu enfeoffed Zhou's son Wu Geng Lu Fu to continue the Yin sacrifices, and had Guan Shu and Cai Shu as assistants to oversee him.
King Wu enfeoffed Zhou's son Wu Geng Lu Fu to continue the Yin sacrifices, and had Guan Shu and Cai Shu as assistants to oversee him.

sentences.zh: 武王既克殷，訪問箕子。

translations.literal: After King Wu conquered Yin, he consulted Jizi.
After King Wu conquered Yin, he consulted Jizi.

sentences.zh: 武王曰：「於乎！
維天陰定下民，相和其居，我不知其常倫所序。」

translations.literal: Heaven secretly determines the people below, harmonizes their dwellings. I do not know the constant order of their sequence.'
King Wu said: 'Ah! Heaven secretly determines the people below, harmonizes their dwellings. I do not know the constant order of their sequence.'

sentences.zh: 箕子對曰：「在昔鯀陻鴻水，汨陳其五行，帝乃震怒，不從鴻範九等，常倫所斁。

translations.literal: Jizi replied: 'In former times Gun blocked the great flood, confused and disturbed the five phases. The emperor then was greatly angered, did not follow the great plan nine divisions, the constant order was disordered.

sentences.zh: 鯀則殛死，禹乃嗣興。

translations.literal: Gun was then executed, Yu then succeeded and rose.

sentences.zh: 天乃錫禹鴻範九等，常倫所序。

translations.literal: Heaven then bestowed on Yu the great plan nine divisions, the constant order of sequence.

Jizi replied: 'In former times Gun blocked the great flood, confused and disturbed the five phases. The emperor then was greatly angered, did not follow the great plan nine divisions, the constant order was disordered. Gun was then executed, Yu then succeeded and rose. Heaven then bestowed on Yu the great plan nine divisions, the constant order of sequence.

sentences.zh: 「初一曰五行；
二曰五事；
三曰八政；
四曰五紀；
五曰皇極；
六曰三德；
七曰稽疑；
八曰庶徵；
九曰嚮用五福，畏用六極。

translations.literal: 'First, the five phases; second, the five affairs; third, the eight policies; fourth, the five records;' fifth, the Royal Ultimate; sixth, the Three Virtues; seventh, Examining Doubts; eighth, the Various Portents; ninth, applying the five blessings, fearing the six extremes."

sentences.zh: 「五行：一曰水，二曰火，三曰木，四曰金，五曰土。

translations.literal: Literal translation: 「五行：一曰水，二曰火，三曰木，四曰金，五曰土。

sentences.zh: 潤下作鹹，炎上作苦，曲直作酸，從革作辛，稼穡作甘。

translations.literal: "The five phases: first, water; second, fire; third, wood; fourth, metal; fifth, earth. Water said moist below, fire said flaming above, wood said curving straight, metal said following change, earth said tilling sowing. Moist below produces salty, flaming above produces bitter, curving straight produces sour, following change produces acrid, tilling sowing produces sweet.

sentences.zh: 「五事：一曰貌，二曰言，三曰視，四曰聽，五曰思。

Appearance said respectful, speech said compliant, seeing said clear, hearing said acute, thinking said profound. Respectful produces solemnity, compliant produces order, clear produces wisdom, acute produces planning, profound produces sageliness.

translations.idiomatic: Idiomatic translation: 曰王極之傅言，是夷是訓，于帝其順。

sentences.zh: 凡厥庶民，極之傅言，是順是行，以近天子之光。

translations.literal: Literal translation: 凡厥庶民，極之傅言，是順是行，以近天子之光。
translations.idiomatic: Idiomatic translation: 凡厥庶民，極之傅言，是順是行，以近天子之光。

sentences.zh: 曰天子作民父母，以為天下王。

translations.literal: Literal translation: 曰天子作民父母，以為天下王。
translations.idiomatic: Idiomatic translation: 曰天子作民父母，以為天下王。

translations.literal: "The Royal Ultimate: The king establishes that he has the ultimate, gathers the five blessings in season, uses them to bestow on his subjects, only then his subjects toward your ultimate, bestow on you preserving the ultimate. All his subjects, let there be no licentious companions, people let there be no comparing virtue, only the king makes the ultimate. All his subjects have plans, have actions, have constancy—you then think of them. Not harmonious with the ultimate, not departing from blame—the king then accepts it. Peaceful and colored, saying 'I approve of virtue'—you then bestow blessing on them. At that time people then this is the king's ultimate. Do not bully the orphaned and fear the eminent. People who have ability and action, make them display their conduct, and the state will flourish. All correct people, having enriched square grain. You cannot make them have good in your family—at that time people then their crime. At their no good, you though bestow blessing on them, its make for you blame. No partial no prejudiced, follow the king's righteousness. No make favor, follow the king's way. No make evil, follow the king's path. No partial no partisan, king's way broad broad. No partisan no partial, king's way level level. No contrary no slanted, king's way straight. Gather their having ultimate, return their having ultimate. Said king's ultimate transmitted words, is peaceful is instructed, toward emperor its compliant. All his subjects, ultimate's transmitted words, is compliant is acted, to approach the Son of Heaven's light. Said Son of Heaven makes people's parents, to be the world's king.

sentences.zh: 「三德：一曰正直，二曰剛克，三曰柔克。

translations.literal: Literal translation: 「三德：一曰正直，二曰剛克，三曰柔克。
translations.idiomatic: Idiomatic translation: 「三德：一曰正直，二曰剛克，三曰柔克。

sentences.zh: 平康正直，彊不友剛克，內友柔克，沈漸剛克，高明柔克。

translations.literal: Literal translation: 平康正直，彊不友剛克，內友柔克，沈漸剛克，高明柔克。
translations.idiomatic: Idiomatic translation: 平康正直，彊不友剛克，內友柔克，沈漸剛克，高明柔克。

sentences.zh: 維辟作福，維辟作威，維辟玉食。

translations.literal: Literal translation: 維辟作福，維辟作威，維辟玉食。
translations.idiomatic: Idiomatic translation: 維辟作福，維辟作威，維辟玉食。

sentences.zh: 臣無有作福作威玉食。

translations.literal: Literal translation: 臣無有作福作威玉食。
translations.idiomatic: Idiomatic translation: 臣無有作福作威玉食。

sentences.zh: 臣有作福作威玉食，其害于而家，凶于而國，人用側頗辟，民用僭忒。

translations.idiomatic: Idiomatic translation: 臣有作福作威玉食，其害于而家，凶于而國，人用側頗辟，民用僭忒。

translations.literal: "The Three Virtues: first, upright; second, overcoming with strength; third, overcoming with gentleness. Peace health upright, strong not befriends overcoming with strength, inner befriends overcoming with gentleness, deep gradual overcoming with strength, high bright overcoming with gentleness. Only the ruler makes blessing, only the ruler makes authority, only the ruler jade food. Subjects have no making blessing making authority jade food. Subjects have making blessing making authority jade food, its harm to your family, ominous to your state, people use slanted prejudiced, subjects use presumptuous perverse.

sentences.zh: 「稽疑：擇建立卜筮人。

translations.literal: Literal translation: 「稽疑：擇建立卜筮人。
translations.idiomatic: Idiomatic translation: 「稽疑：擇建立卜筮人。

sentences.zh: 乃命卜筮，曰雨，曰濟，曰涕，曰霧，曰克，曰貞，曰悔，凡七。

translations.literal: Literal translation: 乃命卜筮，曰雨，曰濟，曰涕，曰霧，曰克，曰貞，曰悔，凡七。
translations.idiomatic: Idiomatic translation: 乃命卜筮，曰雨，曰濟，曰涕，曰霧，曰克，曰貞，曰悔，凡七。

sentences.zh: 卜五，占之用二，衍貣。

translations.literal: Literal translation: 卜五，占之用二，衍貣。
translations.idiomatic: Idiomatic translation: 卜五，占之用二，衍貣。

sentences.zh: 立時人為卜筮，三人占則從二人之言。

translations.literal: Literal translation: 立時人為卜筮，三人占則從二人之言。
translations.idiomatic: Idiomatic translation: 立時人為卜筮，三人占則從二人之言。

sentences.zh: 女則有大疑，謀及女心，謀及卿士，謀及庶人，謀及卜筮。

translations.literal: Literal translation: 女則有大疑，謀及女心，謀及卿士，謀及庶人，謀及卜筮。
translations.idiomatic: Idiomatic translation: 女則有大疑，謀及女心，謀及卿士，謀及庶人，謀及卜筮。

sentences.zh: 女則從，龜從，筮從，卿士從，庶民從，是之謂大同，而身其康彊，而子孫其逢吉。

translations.literal: Literal translation: 女則從，龜從，筮從，卿士從，庶民從，是之謂大同，而身其康彊，而子孫其逢吉。
translations.idiomatic: Idiomatic translation: 女則從，龜從，筮從，卿士從，庶民從，是之謂大同，而身其康彊，而子孫其逢吉。

sentences.zh: 女則從，龜從，筮從，卿士逆，庶民逆，吉。

translations.literal: Literal translation: 女則從，龜從，筮從，卿士逆，庶民逆，吉。
translations.idiomatic: Idiomatic translation: 女則從，龜從，筮從，卿士逆，庶民逆，吉。

translations.literal: Literal translation: 卿士從，龜從，筮從，女則逆，庶民逆，吉。
translations.idiomatic: Idiomatic translation: 卿士從，龜從，筮從，女則逆，庶民逆，吉。

translations.literal: Literal translation: 庶民從，龜從，筮從，女則逆，卿士逆，吉。
translations.idiomatic: Idiomatic translation: 庶民從，龜從，筮從，女則逆，卿士逆，吉。

translations.idiomatic: Idiomatic translation: 女則從，龜從，筮逆，卿士逆，庶民逆，作內吉，作外凶。

sentences.zh: 龜筮共違于人，用靜吉，用作凶。

translations.literal: Literal translation: 龜筮共違于人，用靜吉，用作凶。
translations.idiomatic: Idiomatic translation: 龜筮共違于人，用靜吉，用作凶。

translations.literal: "Examining Doubts: Choose establish divination and milfoil people. Then command divination and milfoil, said rain, said aid, said tears, said mist, said overcome, said divination, said regret, altogether seven. Divine five, occupy using two, derive calamity. Establish timely people as divination and milfoil, three occupy then follow two people's words. You then have great doubt, consult your heart, consult ministers and knights, consult the common people, consult divination and milfoil. You then follow, turtle follows, milfoil follows, ministers and knights follow, common people follow—this is called great agreement, and person its peaceful strong, and descendants their meet good. You then follow, turtle follows, milfoil follows, ministers and knights contrary, common people contrary, auspicious. Ministers and knights follow, turtle follows, milfoil follows, you then contrary, common people contrary, auspicious. Common people follow, turtle follows, milfoil follows, you then contrary, ministers and knights contrary, auspicious. You then follow, turtle follows, milfoil contrary, ministers and knights contrary, common people contrary, make inner auspicious, make outer ominous. Turtle milfoil together contrary to people, use quiet auspicious, use action ominous."

sentences.zh: 「庶徵：曰雨，曰陽，曰奧，曰寒，曰風，曰時。
五者來備，各以其序，庶草繁廡。
一極備，凶。
一極亡，凶。
曰休徵：曰肅，時雨若，曰治，時暘若；
曰知，時奧若；
曰謀，時寒若；
曰聖，時風若。
曰咎徵：曰狂，常雨若；
曰僭，常暘若；
曰舒，常奧若；
曰急，常寒若；
曰霧，常風若。
王眚維歲，卿士維月，師尹維日。
歲月日時毋易，百穀用成，治用明，畯民用章，家用平康。
日月歲時既易，百穀用不成，治用昏不明，畯民用微，家用不寧。
庶民維星，星有好風，星有好雨。
日月之行，有冬有夏。
月之從星，則以風雨。

translations.literal: "Various Portents: said rain, said sunshine, said warm, said cold, said wind, said season. Five come prepared, each in their sequence, all grasses lush abundant. One extreme prepared, ominous. One extreme absent, ominous. Said auspicious portents: said solemn, timely rain if; said orderly, timely sunshine if; said wise, timely warm if; said planning, timely cold if; said sagely, timely wind if. Said blame portents: said mad, constant rain if; said presumptuous, constant sunshine if; said lax, constant warm if; said urgent, constant cold if; said foggy, constant wind if. King's errors for year, ministers and knights for month, officers for day. Year month day season no change, hundred grains use completion, governance use bright, strong people use manifest, family use peaceful health. Day month year season already changed, hundred grains use incompletion, governance use dark unclear, strong people use faint, family use unpeaceful. Common people like stars, stars have good wind, stars have good rain. Sun moon's movement, has winter has summer. Moon's following stars, then with wind rain.

sentences.zh: 「五福：一曰壽，二曰富，三曰康寧，四曰攸好德，五曰考終命。
六極：一曰凶短折，二曰疾，三曰憂，四曰貧，五曰惡，六曰弱。」

translations.literal: "Five blessings: first, longevity; second, wealth; third, health peace; fourth, doing good virtue; fifth, good end of life. Six extremes: first, ominous short breaking; second, illness; third, worry; fourth, poverty; fifth, hate; sixth, weakness."

sentences.zh: 於是武王乃封箕子於朝鮮而不臣也。

translations.literal: Thereupon King Wu enfeoffed Jizi in Chaoxian without making him a subject.

sentences.zh: 其後箕子朝周，過故殷虛，感宮室毀壞，生禾黍，箕子傷之，欲哭則不可，欲泣為其近婦人，乃作麥秀之詩以歌詠之。
其詩曰：「麥秀漸漸兮，禾黍油油。
彼狡僮兮，不與我好兮！」
所謂狡童者，紂也。
殷民聞之，皆為流涕。

translations.literal: Afterward Jizi went to court Zhou, passed the former Yin ruins, was saddened by the palace chambers destroyed, growing wheat and millet. Jizi was pained, wanted to cry but could not, wanted to weep for being near women, so made the Mai Xiu poem to sing it. His poem said: "Wheat sprouts gradually ah, millet and wheat oily oily. That crafty boy ah, not be good with me ah!" The so-called crafty boy was Zhou. Yin people hearing it, all shed tears.

sentences.zh: 武王崩，成王少，周公旦代行政當國。
管、蔡疑之，乃與武庚作亂，欲襲成王、周公。
周公既承成王命誅武庚，殺管叔，放蔡叔，乃命微子開代殷後，奉其先祀，作微子之命以申之，國于宋。
微子故能仁賢，乃代武庚，故殷之餘民甚戴愛之。

translations.literal: King Wu passed away, King Cheng was young, Duke of Zhou Dan administered government and managed the state. Guan and Cai doubted it, so with Wu Geng made rebellion, wanted to attack King Cheng and Duke of Zhou. Duke of Zhou having received King Cheng's command to execute Wu Geng, kill Guan Shu, banish Cai Shu, then commanded Weizi Kai to replace Yin's successor, uphold their ancestral sacrifices, made Weizi's command to declare it, established state at Song. Weizi originally was benevolent and worthy, replaced Wu Geng, so Yin's remaining people greatly cherished and loved him.

sentences.zh: 釐公十七年，周厲王出奔彘。

translations.literal: In the seventeenth year of Xi Gong, King Li of Zhou fled to Zhi.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，釐公卒，子惠公覵立。
惠公四年，周宣王即位。
三十年，惠公卒，子哀公立。
哀公元年卒，子戴公立。

translations.literal: Twenty-eighth year, Xi Gong died, son Hui Gong Xun ascended. Fourth year of Hui Gong, King Xuan of Zhou ascended the throne. Thirtieth year, Hui Gong died, son Ai Gong ascended. First year Ai Gong died, son Dai Gong ascended.

sentences.zh: 戴公二十九年，周幽王為犬戎所殺，秦始列為諸侯。

translations.literal: Twenty-ninth year of Dai Gong, King You of Zhou was killed by the Quanrong, Qin first ranked as feudal lord.

sentences.zh: 三十四年，戴公卒，子武公司空立。
武公生女為魯惠公夫人，生魯桓公。
十八年，武公卒，子宣公力立。

translations.literal: Thirty-fourth year, Dai Gong died, son Wu Gong Si Kong ascended. Wu Gong gave birth to daughter who became wife of Duke Hui of Lu, gave birth to Duke Huan of Lu. Eighteenth year, Wu Gong died, son Xuan Gong Li ascended.

sentences.zh: 宣公有太子與夷。
十九年，宣公病，讓其弟和，曰：「父死子繼，兄死弟及，天下通義也。
我其立和。」
和亦三讓而受之。
宣公卒，弟和立，是為穆公。

translations.literal: Xuan Gong had crown prince Yu Yi. Nineteenth year, Xuan Gong was ill, yielded to his younger brother He, saying: "Father dies son succeeds, elder brother dies younger brother reaches, world's universal righteousness. I will establish He." He also three times declined and accepted it. Xuan Gong died, younger brother He ascended, this was Mu Gong.

sentences.zh: 穆公九年，病，召大司馬孔父謂曰：「先君宣公捨太子與夷而立我，我不敢忘。
我死，必立與夷也。」
孔父曰：「群臣皆願立公子馮。」
穆公曰：「毋立馮，吾不可以負宣公。」
於是穆公使馮出居于鄭。
八月庚辰，穆公卒，兄宣公子與夷立，是為殤公。
君子聞之，曰：「宋宣公可謂知人矣，立其弟以成義，然卒其子復享之。

translations.literal: Ninth year of Mu Gong, was ill, summoned Grand Marshal Kong Fu and said: "Former lord Xuan Gong abandoned crown prince Yu Yi and established me, I dare not forget. When I die, must establish Yu Yi." Kong Fu said: "All ministers all wish to establish Duke Feng." Mu Gong said: "Do not establish Feng, I cannot betray Xuan Gong." Thereupon Mu Gong made Feng go out and reside in Zheng. Eighth month geng chen, Mu Gong died, elder brother Xuan Gong's son Yu Yi ascended, this was Shang Gong. The gentleman hearing it said: "Song Xuan Gong can be called knowing people, established his younger brother to complete righteousness, yet ultimately his son again enjoyed it.

sentences.zh: 莊公元年，華督為相。
九年，執鄭之祭仲，要以立突為鄭君。
祭仲許，竟立突。
十九年，莊公卒，子湣公捷立。

translations.literal: First year of Zhuang Gong, Hua Du was chancellor. Ninth year, seized Zheng's Ji Zhong, coerced to establish Tu as Zheng ruler. Ji Zhong agreed, ultimately established Tu. Nineteenth year, Zhuang Gong died, son Min Gong Jie ascended.

sentences.zh: 十年夏，宋伐魯，戰於乘丘，魯生虜宋南宮萬。
宋人請萬，萬歸宋。
十一年秋，湣公與南宮萬獵，因博爭行，湣公怒，辱之，曰：「始吾敬若；
今若，魯虜也。」
萬有力，病此言，遂以局殺湣公于蒙澤。
大夫仇牧聞之，以兵造公門。
萬搏牧，牧齒著門闔死。
因殺太宰華督，乃更立公子游為君。
諸公子奔蕭，公子御說奔亳。
萬弟南宮牛將兵圍亳。
冬，蕭及宋之諸公子共擊殺南宮牛，弒宋新君游而立湣公弟御說，是為桓公。
宋萬奔陳。
宋人請以賂陳。
陳人使婦人飲之醇酒，以革裹之，歸宋。
宋人醢萬也。

translations.literal: Tenth year summer, Song attacked Lu, battled at Cheng Qiu, Lu captured alive Song Nan Gong Wan. Song people requested Wan, Wan returned to Song. Eleventh year autumn, Min Gong with Nan Gong Wan hunted, because of board game disputed walking, Min Gong angered, insulted him, said: "Initially I respected you; now you are Lu's captive." Wan was strong, resented these words, thereupon with board killed Min Gong at Meng Ze. Knight Qiu Mu heard it, with troops went to the duke's gate. Wan wrestled Mu, Mu's teeth bit the gate door died. Thereupon killed Grand Steward Hua Du, then established Duke You as ruler. Various dukes fled to Xiao, Duke Yu Yue fled to Bo. Wan's younger brother Nan Gong Niu led troops surrounded Bo. Winter, Xiao and Song's various dukes together attacked and killed Nan Gong Niu, assassinated Song's new ruler You and established Min Gong's younger brother Yu Yue, this was Huan Gong. Song Wan fled to Chen. Song people requested with bribes Chen. Chen people made woman give him strong wine to drink, wrapped in leather, returned to Song. Song people made Wan into paste.

sentences.zh: 襄公七年，宋地茀星如雨，與雨偕下；
六鶂退蜚，風疾也。

translations.literal: Seventh year of Xiang Gong, Song territory shooting star like rain, with rain came down; six pheasants retreated flying, wind fierce.

sentences.zh: 八年，齊桓公卒，宋欲為盟會。
十二年春，宋襄公為鹿上之盟，以求諸侯於楚，楚人許之。
公子目夷諫曰：「小國爭盟，禍也。」
不聽。
秋，諸侯會宋公盟于盂。
目夷曰：「禍其在此乎？
君欲已甚，何以堪之！」
於是楚執宋襄公以伐宋。
冬，會于亳，以釋宋公。
子魚曰：「禍猶未也。」
十三年夏，宋伐鄭。
子魚曰：「禍在此矣。」
秋，楚伐宋以救鄭。
襄公將戰，子魚諫曰：「天之棄商久矣，不可。」
冬，十一月，襄公與楚成王戰于泓。
楚人未濟，目夷曰：「彼眾我寡，及其未濟擊之。」
公不聽。
已濟未陳，又曰：「可擊。」
公曰：「待其已陳。」
陳成，宋人擊之。
宋師大敗，襄公傷股。
國人皆怨公。
公曰：「君子不困人於阸，不鼓不成列。」
子魚曰：「兵以勝為功，何常言與！
必如公言，即奴事之耳，又何戰為？」

translations.literal: Eighth year, Duke Huan of Qi died, Song wished to hold alliance meeting. Twelfth year spring, Duke Xiang of Song made the Lu Shang alliance, to seek feudal lords from Chu, Chu people agreed. Duke Mu Yi admonished saying: "Small state contending alliance, disaster." Did not listen. Autumn, feudal lords met Duke Xiang alliance at Yu. Mu Yi said: "Disaster perhaps here? Lord desires too much, how can endure!" Thereupon Chu seized Duke Xiang of Song to attack Song. Winter, assembled at Bo, to release Duke Xiang. Zi Yu said: "Disaster still not ended." Thirteenth year summer, Song attacked Zheng. Zi Yu said: "Disaster here." Autumn, Chu attacked Song to save Zheng. Duke Xiang would battle, Zi Yu admonished saying: "Heaven abandoned Shang long ago, cannot." Winter, eleventh month, Duke Xiang with King Cheng of Chu battled at Hong. Chu people not yet crossed, Mu Yi said: "They many we few, when they not yet crossed attack them." Duke did not listen. Already crossed not yet arrayed, again said: "Can attack." Duke said: "Wait until they arrayed." Array completed, Song people attacked them. Song army greatly defeated, Duke Xiang wounded thigh. State people all resented duke. Duke said: "Gentleman does not distress people in straits, does not drum unformed ranks." Zi Yu said: "War with victory as merit, what constant words! Must like duke says, then serve as slave, moreover what battle for?"

sentences.zh: 楚成王已救鄭，鄭享之；
去而取鄭二姬以歸。
叔瞻曰：「成王無禮，其不沒乎？
為禮卒於無別，有以知其不遂霸也。」

translations.literal: King Cheng of Chu already saved Zheng, Zheng feasted him; Departed and took Zheng two ladies to return. Shu Zhan said: "Cheng Wang without ritual, will he not perish? For ritual ended in no distinction, have means to know he will not succeed hegemony."

sentences.zh: 是年，晉公子重耳過宋，襄公以傷於楚，欲得晉援，厚禮重耳以馬二十乘。

translations.literal: This year, Jin duke Chong'er passed Song, Duke Xiang with injury from Chu, wished to obtain Jin aid, thickly gifted Chong'er with twenty chariot horses.

sentences.zh: 十四年夏，襄公病傷於泓而竟卒，子成公王臣立。

translations.literal: Fourteenth year summer, Duke Xiang injured at Hong and ultimately died, son Cheng Gong Wang Chen ascended.

sentences.zh: 十七年，成公卒。
成公弟御殺太子及大司馬公孫固而自立為君。
宋人共殺君御而立成公少子杵臼，是為昭公。

translations.literal: Seventeenth year, Cheng Gong died. Cheng Gong's younger brother Yu killed the crown prince and Grand Marshal Gong Sun Gu and established himself as ruler. Song people together killed ruler Yu and established Cheng Gong's young son Chu Jiu, this was Zhao Gong.

sentences.zh: 九年，昭公無道，國人不附。
昭公弟鮑革賢而下士。
先，襄公夫人欲通於公子鮑，不可，乃助之施於國，因大夫華元為右師。
昭公出獵，夫人王姬使衛伯攻殺昭公杵臼。
弟鮑革立，是為文公。

translations.literal: Ninth year, Zhao Gong without way, state people not attached. Zhao Gong's younger brother Bao Ge worthy and approached scholars. Previously, Xiang Gong's wife wished to communicate with Duke Bao, could not, then helped him distribute to the state, through knight Hua Yuan as right teacher. Zhao Gong went hunting, wife Wang Ji sent Wei Bo to attack and kill Zhao Gong Chu Jiu. Younger brother Bao Ge ascended, this was Wen Gong.

sentences.zh: 四年春，（鄭）［楚］命（楚）［鄭］伐宋。
宋使華元將，鄭敗宋，囚華元。
華元之將戰，殺羊以食士，其御羊羹不及，故怨，馳入鄭軍，故宋師敗，得囚華元。
宋以兵車百乘文馬四百匹贖華元。
未盡入，華元亡歸宋。

translations.literal: Fourth year spring, Chu commanded Zheng attack Song. Song sent Hua Yuan to lead, Zheng defeated Song, imprisoned Hua Yuan. Hua Yuan's about to battle, killed sheep to feed soldiers, his charioteer missed the sheep soup, therefore resented, galloped into Zheng army, therefore Song army defeated, got imprisoned Hua Yuan. Song with war chariots hundred, fine horses four hundred redeemed Hua Yuan. Not yet completely entered, Hua Yuan escaped returned to Song.

sentences.zh: 十四年，楚莊王圍鄭。
鄭伯降楚，楚復釋之。

translations.literal: Fourteenth year, King Zhuang of Chu surrounded Zheng. Duke of Zheng submitted to Chu, Chu again released him.

sentences.zh: 十六年，楚使過宋，宋有前仇，執楚使。
九月，楚莊王圍宋。
十七年，楚以圍宋五月不解，宋城中急，無食，華元乃夜私見楚將子反。
子反告莊王。
王問：「城中何如？」
曰：「析骨而炊，易子而食。」
莊王曰：「誠哉言！
我軍亦有二日糧。」
以信故，遂罷兵去。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, Chu envoy passed Song, Song had previous enmity, seized Chu envoy. Ninth month, King Zhuang of Chu surrounded Song. Seventeenth year, Chu with surrounding Song five months not resolved, Song city urgent, no food, Hua Yuan then at night privately met Chu general Zi Fan. Zi Fan told Zhuang Wang. Wang asked: "City within what like?" Said: "Split bones and cook, exchange children and eat." Zhuang Wang said: "Truly these words! My army also has two days rations." Because of sincerity, thereupon withdrew troops departed.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，文公卒，子共公瑕立。
始厚葬。
君子譏華元不臣矣。

translations.literal: Twenty-second year, Wen Gong died, son Gong Gong Xia ascended. Began thick burial. Gentleman criticized Hua Yuan not subject-like.

sentences.zh: 共公（元）［十］年，華元善楚將子重，又善晉將欒書，兩盟晉楚。
十三年，共公卒。
華元為右師，魚石為左師。
司馬唐山攻殺太子肥，欲殺華元，華元奔晉，魚石止之，至河乃還，誅唐山。
乃立共公少子成，是為平公。

translations.literal: Tenth year of Gong Gong, Hua Yuan befriended Chu general Zi Chong, also befriended Jin general Luan Shu, both allied Jin Chu. Thirteenth year, Gong Gong died. Hua Yuan as right teacher, Yu Shi as left teacher. Marshal Tang Shan attacked killed crown prince Fei, wished to kill Hua Yuan, Hua Yuan fled Jin, Yu Shi stopped him, to river then returned, executed Tang Shan. Then established Gong Gong's young son Cheng, this was Ping Gong.

sentences.zh: 平公三年，楚共王拔宋之彭城，以封宋左師魚石。
四年，諸侯共誅魚石，而歸彭城於宋。
三十五年，楚公子圍弒其君自立，為靈王。
四十四年，平公卒，子元公佐立。

translations.literal: Third year of Ping Gong, King Gong of Chu took Song's Pengcheng, to enfeoff left teacher Yu Shi. Fourth year, feudal lords together executed Yu Shi, returned Pengcheng to Song. Thirty-fifth year, Chu duke Wei assassinated his lord self-established, became Ling Wang. Forty-fourth year, Ping Gong died, son Yuan Gong Zuo ascended.

sentences.zh: 元公三年，楚公子棄疾弒靈王，自立為平王。
八年，宋火。
十年，元公毋信，詐殺諸公子，大夫華、向氏作亂。
楚平王太子建來奔，見諸華氏相攻亂，建去如鄭。
十五年，元公為魯昭公避季氏居外，為之求入魯，行道卒，子景公頭曼立。

translations.literal: Third year of Yuan Gong, Chu duke Qi Ji assassinated Ling Wang, self-established as Ping Wang. Eighth year, Song fire. Tenth year, Yuan Gong without faith, deceitfully killed various dukes, knight Hua, Xiang clans made rebellion. Chu Ping Wang crown prince Jian came fleeing, saw various Hua clans attacking each other in chaos, Jian departed to Zheng. Fifteenth year, Yuan Gong for Lu Zhao Gong avoided Ji clan resided outside, sought entry to Lu for him, en route died, son Jing Gong Tou Man ascended.

sentences.zh: 景公十六年，魯陽虎來奔，已復去。
二十五年，孔子過宋，宋司馬桓魋惡之，欲殺孔子，孔子微服去。
三十年，曹倍宋，又倍晉，宋伐曹，晉不救，遂滅曹有之。
三十六年，齊田常弒簡公。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year of Jing Gong, Lu Yang Hu came fleeing, afterward again departed. Twenty-fifth year, Confucius passed Song, Song marshal Huan Kui hated him, wished to kill Confucius, Confucius disguised departed. Thirtieth year, Cao betrayed Song, also betrayed Jin, Song attacked Cao, Jin not aided, thereupon extinguished Cao possessed it. Thirty-sixth year, Qi Tian Chang assassinated Jian Gong.

sentences.zh: 三十七年，楚惠王滅陳。
熒惑守心。
心，宋之分野也。
景公憂之。
司星子韋曰：「可移於相。」
景公曰：「相，吾之股肱。」
曰：「可移於民。」
景公曰：「君者待民。」
曰：「可移於歲。」
景公曰：「歲饑民困，吾誰為君！」
子韋曰：「天高聽卑。
君有君人之言三，熒惑宜有動。」
於是候之，果徙三度。

translations.literal: Thirty-seventh year, King Hui of Chu extinguished Chen. Mars guarded heart. Heart is Song's constellation field. Jing Gong worried it. Star officer Zi Wei said: "Can shift to chancellor." Jing Gong said: "Chancellor is my limbs." Said: "Can shift to people." Jing Gong said: "Ruler awaits people." Said: "Can shift to year." Jing Gong said: "Year famine people distressed, I for whom be ruler!" Zi Wei said: "Heaven high listens low. Lord has ruler people's words three, Mars should have movement." Thereupon observed it, indeed moved three degrees.

sentences.zh: 六十四年，景公卒。
宋公子特攻殺太子而自立，是為昭公。
昭公者，元公之曾庶孫也。
昭公父公孫糾，糾父公子褍秦，褍秦即元公少子也。
景公殺昭公父糾，故昭公怨殺太子而自立。

translations.literal: Sixty-fourth year, Jing Gong died. Song duke Te attacked killed crown prince self-established, this was Zhao Gong. Zhao Gong was Yuan Gong's great concubine grandson. Zhao Gong father Gong Sun Jiu, Jiu father duke Chou Qin, Chou Qin was Yuan Gong young son. Jing Gong killed Zhao Gong father Jiu, therefore Zhao Gong resented killed crown prince self-established.

sentences.zh: 昭公四十七年卒，子悼公購由立。
悼公八年卒，子休公田立。
休公田二十三年卒，子辟公辟兵立。
辟公三年卒，子剔成立。
剔成四十一年，剔成弟偃攻襲剔成，剔成敗奔齊，偃自立為宋君。

translations.literal: Forty-seventh year Zhao Gong died, son Dao Gong Gou You ascended. Eighth year Dao Gong died, son Xiu Gong Tian ascended. Twenty-third year Xiu Gong Tian died, son Bi Gong Bi Bing ascended. Third year Bi Gong died, son Ti Cheng ascended. Forty-first year Ti Cheng, Ti Cheng younger brother Yan attacked Ti Cheng, Ti Cheng defeated fled Qi, Yan self-established as Song ruler.

sentences.zh: 君偃十一年，自立為王。
東敗齊，取五城；
南敗楚，取地三百里；
西敗魏軍，乃與齊、魏為敵國。
盛血以韋囊，縣而射之，命曰「射天」。
淫於酒婦人。
群臣諫者輒射之。
於是諸侯皆曰「桀宋」。
「宋其復為紂所為，不可不誅」。
告齊伐宋。
王偃立四十七年，齊湣王與魏、楚伐宋，殺王偃，遂滅宋而三分其地。

translations.literal: Ruler Yan eleventh year, self-established as king. East defeated Qi, took five cities; South defeated Chu, took three hundred li land; West defeated Wei army, then with Qi, Wei as enemy states. Filled blood with leather bag, hung and shot it, named "shoot heaven". Licentious in wine and women. Ministers admonishing then shot them. Thereupon feudal lords all said "cruel Song". "Song will again do as Zhou did, cannot not execute". Informed Qi attack Song. Wang Yan established forty-seventh year, Qi Min Wang with Wei, Chu attacked Song, killed Wang Yan, thereupon extinguished Song and divided its land three ways.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：孔子稱「微子去之，箕子為之奴，比干諫而死，殷有三仁焉」。
春秋譏宋之亂自宣公廢太子而立弟，國以不寧者十世。
襄公之時，修行仁義，欲為盟主。
其大夫正考父美之，故追道契、湯、高宗，殷所以興，作商頌。
襄公既敗於泓，而君子或以為多，傷中國闕禮義，褒之也，宋襄之有禮讓也。

translations.literal: The Grand Historian says: Confucius said "Weizi departed, Jizi became slave, Bigan admonished and died, Yin had three benevolent ones". Spring and Autumn criticizes Song's chaos from Xuan Gong discarding crown prince establishing younger brother, state with unpeaceful ten generations. Xiang Gong's time, practiced benevolence righteousness, wished to be alliance leader. His knight Zheng Kao Fu praised it, therefore traced way of Qi, Tang, Gao Zong, Yin's rise reason, made Shang Song. Xiang Gong already defeated at Hong, and gentleman some considered it excessive, injured China lacking ritual righteousness, praised it, Song Xiang's having ritual yielding.
